column_.text_:
One day, an Erste Empire battleship suddenly appears over
Zinkenstill, 's island home. A light descends from
the ship, and  rushes into the woods to investigate.
There,  finds a blue-haired girl named Lyria being
hounded by the empire. When the imperial pursuers catch up to
her, they release a dreadful monster.  battles valiantly
to protect Lyria but ultimately suffers fatal injuries in the one-sided
fight.

As  slips close to death, Lyria links her lifeforce to
's own. Not only does the girl's determination
save 's life, it triggers a powerful reaction that
summons Bahamut, a fearsome black dragon who drives off
the imperials. From that day forward, the fates of Lyria and
 would be inextricably linked.

's father left Zinkenstill many years ago, leaving
behind a letter telling  to come to the promised
land—an island called Estalucia.  has dreamed
of venturing out into the vast blue sky ever since. Now,
accompanied by Lyria and her guardian Katalina, that journey
is no longer a dream but a reality.

Like their father before them,  decides to
form a skyfarer crew for the journey ahead. Arriving in Port
Breeze Archipelago,  visits the local Knickknack
Shack and learns about Rackam, a former helmsman who has
since given up the trade. Though he has no intention of flying
again, he changes his mind when the Erste Empire attacks Port
Breeze. Amid the conflict, Rackam's passion for flying returns,
and afterward he pledges his piloting skills and ship, the
Grandcypher, to 's cause.

's fledgling crew grows with each visit to a new
locale. In Valtz Duchy, they recruit Io, a promising mage with
exceptional talent. In Auguste, the anti-imperial sharpshooter
Eugen joins their ranks, as does Rosetta, a shrewd, mysterious
beauty hailing from Lumacie. As more allies come aboard the
Grandcypher, their conflict with the empire approaches a
climactic showdown.

The prime minister of the Erste Empire intends to sacrifice the
citizens of the imperial capital in order to activate the primal
beast Akasha and use its power to rewrite history.
's crew and allies put a stop to the prime minister's
scheme by sealing away the primal. Once defanged, the empire
quickly loses its authority and collapses.

After taking down the Erste Empire, 's crew leaves
the Phantagrande Skydom to continue their journey. They pass
through the skydoms of Nalhegrande and Oarlyegrande to arrive
on the doorstep of a vast expanse they've yet to explore:
Zegagrande Skydom.

Somewhere in a far-flung sky, a lonesome soul begins to
recall a fractured memory.

The Grandcypher speeds through the storm clouds of the
Grim Basin.

Crossing the Grim Basin, 's crew arrive in the
Zegagrande Skydom, where their hearts are set alight by the
majesty of an unexplored skydom.

When a flock of wyverns swarms the Grandcypher, 
and Lyria summon Bahamut. What should have been an easy
victory turns into a treacherous battle as a sudden madness
grips Bahamut, causing it to attack the crew.

Having pacified the raging Bahamut, Lyria reabsorbs its
tremendous power. However, the exertion causes her to lose
consciousness and she falls overboard.  and
Vyrn catch her and try to pull her to safety, but the momentum
is too much, and the trio go tumbling to the island below.

Barely conscious,  catches a glimpse of the past—of
saving Lyria and suffering a fatal wound, then of Lyria sharing
her own life to save .
Vyrn's frantic calling rouses  from unconsciousness.

rescues Lyria from a monster assault.
Overjoyed by the reunion, they breathe sighs of relief.

The crew exits the forest and strolls into Folca, a pleasant
town with a nostalgic vibe.

Even here in Folca,  finds Sierokarte of the
Knickknack Shack. Having aided the crew in past exploits,
she offers her help in this skydom.

After a walk around town, the crew assembles in front of a
church, only to witness a bespectacled man burst out of the
hallowed halls.
Leave It to Mr. Fix It!

En route to Tempeal, Rolan formally introduces himself to the
crew. Working as Folca's resident handyman, he boasts that he
can handle anything from furniture repair to marriage counseling.

A sudden gale hits the ship. Rolan expertly steers it into Tempeal,
where the crew finds refugees waiting. However, they are fewer
in number than expected, causing Rolan to grow concerned.

The primal beast Furycane appears before a wind-battered
crew. It brandishes its blade and charges.

The crew puts a stop to Furycane's rampage. Just as the storm
subsides and all seems well, a red ship appears from the cloud
cover. A curious group disembarks and encircles the crew. They 
try to take Lyria by force, but Katalina foils them. A mysterious
swordsman steps forward to ensure Lyria's capture.

After the crew suffers defeat at the hands of the extremely
powerful Id, the Pilgrims of Avia's leader—a woman named
Lilith—makes herself known. She refers to Lyria as the
"Shaman of Salvation" before making off with the girl.

has nightmares over failing to protect
Lyria and awakens to see Vyrn tearing up with worry.

receives a set of equipment from Rolan
before resolving to bring Lyria back at any cost.

The crew finally catches up to the red ship that kidnapped
Lyria. The enemy's artillery, however, is far more powerful than
anticipated, and the Grandcypher is greatly damaged. Although
Rolan's quick thinking rescues the crew from danger, Avia's
soldiers launch an attack.
Gallanza of the Silver Wolf Corps

Just when the crew has the red ship cornered, a hulking man
with a massive spear comes flying aboard the Grandcypher.
He announces himself as Gallanza of the Silver Wolf Corps
and challenges the crew to a "deathmatch."

The crew butts heads with Gallanza but fails to break his
fierce spirit. The general is prepared to keep fighting, but a
mysterious, cloaked woman appears behind him and chides
him for his recklessness. Both flee before the crew can
apprehend them.

The red ship lands near Mt. Neigelith's altar. Immediately,
calamity strikes as a violent blizzard forms from nothing.
Aware that the Grandcypher can't withstand much more, the
crew makes an emergency landing at the foot of the mountain.

The crew spot the monastery at the end of the bridge. While
crossing, however, they are ambushed by a familiar figure and
her posse, who destroy the bridge. Helpless, the crew fall into
ravine below.

Faced with a worsening blizzard and endless monster attacks,
the crew is saved by Historiath, Rolan's acquitance and solemn
protector of the local monastery.

The crew finally finds Lyria, but something seems amiss—she
doesn't react at all upon seeing  and Katalina.
All of a sudden, a mysterious attack shoots from Lyria's back. 
Historiath tries to fight back, but her attack is parried and
countered by Id. To the crew's confusion, Id appears in front
of Lyria—as if to protect her.

In the midst of a fierce battle with Id, Lyria summons the
primal beast Managarmr.

The crew need a method to save Lyria. They set out for a
large city known as Seedhollow to gather intel.
The crew meets with the imposing Zathba.

Id dreams about the day he lost everything, but the vision is
fragmented, distorted.

The crew has obtained the catalyst, but their joy is short-lived,
as a familiar enemy faction ambushes them once more. Their
leader, a haughty sorceress named Maglielle, introduces them
as the Sword Veil Fellowship before she orders them to attack.

Defeating the powerful Maglielle, the crew secures the catalyst.
The Fellowship, driven into a corner, throw their swords at the
ancient treasure coffer. This causes the altar's defense
mechanism, primal beast Excavallion, to awaken.

's crew destroys the main core of Excavallion,
neutralizing it. Both Zathba and Rolan are left speechless by
the fight. With the catalyst in hand, the crew redoubles their
focus on saving Lyria.

The crew arrives at a flaming altar, where they find Id facing
off with a primal beast which seems to have trapped Lyria
within a crystal atop its crown. When it flees into its volcanic
lair, the crew gives chase.

After a trying battle, the crew defeat Vulkan Bolla and rescues
Lyria. But before they can even breathe a sigh of relief, Avia's
leader Lilith appears. She snatches Lyria once more and
confronts the crew with overwhelming power.

The crew is bested by Lilith.  tries to resist her, but 
Avia's leader proves too strong. Fearing they've lost Lyria forever,
the crew is overcome with sorrow. At that moment, however, 
Rolan appears and frees them from Lilith's magic.

Rolan reveals that he, like Lilith, is an Astral. The crew are
shocked by the revelation, but the arrival of a swarm of Avia
vessels gives them precious little time to adjust. Instead, they
hurriedly prepare for battle.

After numerous fights, the crew finally catch up to Lilith. She
leaves Id to handle them and turns to open a gate to the Astral
Realm. But before she completes the ritual, Rolan launches a
surprise attack, disrupting her. In the commotion, both Astrals
and Lyria are thrown into the incomplete gate, leaving the crew
to fight Id alone.

The battle is fierce, but the crew defeat Id and leap into the
dimensional rift after Lyria. They manage to secure her, but
Lilith and Rolan are engaged in intense combat. Seeing an
opening, Lilith activates Angra Mainyu, whose power is enough
to annihilate her rival Astral in a blink. Though shaken by the
shock of losing a stalwart ally, they have no choice but to
face Lilith.

Using Angra Mainyu's power, Lilith erases precious allies one by
one. She soon comes to Lyria and erases her in front of
 and Id, who comes running to Lyria's aid. Lilith tries
to erase  as well, but Id distracts his maternal
figure. Realizing what must be done,  focuses
on searching for Lyria's presence.

, bolstered by the faint sound of Lyria's voice,
strikes a decisive blow on Angra Mainyu. As its manufactured
dimension begins to collapse,  locates Lyria
and reaches a hand out to save her. Their bond summons
the Wings of Darkness, and the immense power pries the
space open for another battle with Angra Mainyu.

After Angra Mainyu is obliterated,  and the
crew find themselves back at Seedhollow Castle. Everyone is
all smiles when they realize not a member was lost to the
primal's foul magic.

Lilith revives Angra Mainyu by exploiting Rolan's immense
magical reserves. Then, to gain certain passage to the Astral
Realm, she gathers debris from across the skydom and forms
it into an impromptu altar: the Pillar of Vayoi. Meanwhile, the
crew escapes the collapsing Seedhollow Castle. Id, having seen
everything, soon follows suit.

The crew put their history with Id aside and welcome him
as an ally. Though visibly hesitant at first, Id senses the crew's
shared desire to stop Lilith, and thus he forms a pact with
.

With help from Gallanza and Maglielle, the crew reach the top
of the Pillar of Vayoi. There, they find Lilith overjoyed to at last
be opening the gate to the Astral Realm. Lilith leaves no room
for discussion—she activates Angra Mainyu, forcing the crew
to challenge the beast once more.

The crew vanquishes Angra Mainyu and rescues Rolan. However,
Lilith decides to use her last resort: sacrificing herself to fuse
with Angra Mainyu. When everything seems hopeless, Zathba,
Historiath, and scores of other allies come rushing to their aid.
Empowered by the bonds they've forged in Zegagrande, the
crew lead the final battle, displaying the unity of skydwellers in
times of turmoil.

At long last, 's crew defeats Lilith. Lyria
absorbs Angra Mainyu, and a powerless Lilith hangs her head
in defeat. Id tells Lilith they should atone together, but she
destroys the mind sealer on Id's neck, freeing Bahamut Versa,
a god of destruction she sealed inside of Id long ago.

A young boy's memories in the sky... He was lost in the
depths of despair, but her gesture was a lie. Lilith had only
used Id as a vessel to seal Bahamut. Turned inhuman and
overtaken by a destructive will, Id casts off even Lilith, who
he'd revered as a mother, and flees into the void.

The crew manage to hold back Bahamut Versa with Rolan's
sealing spell. Determined to bring Id back, they engage in
the final battle.

Together with Id, now shaken free of the god of destruction's
control, the crew corners Bahamut Versa. Id entrusts the
entirety of his being to  and Lyria.

As Bahamut Versa emerges again from the gate, 
and Id's desperate strike fully silences the god, sinking it into
a sliver between dimensions. However, they too are pulled in.
Just as hope seems lost, Rolan pries the gate open to rescue
them. Having spent all his magic, he watches them through
the closing gate with a smile.

Id and  return to the Sky Realm, humbled
and downtrodden by Rolan's sacrifice. A final message from
Rolan arrives through the transceiver: "It'd take a load off my
mind if you could check in on the people of Folca." To fulfill
his last wish, and perhaps find a way to save him, the crew
make their way to Folca.

The crew return to the skies after their battle with Bahamut 
Versa. Using the dragon power latent within him, Id attempts 
to open a gate to the dimensional rift. Thanks to Proto Bahamut's 
aid, the crew succeeds in opening the gate. They embark on their 
final quest: to rescue Rolan and restore peace to the skies.

Though Bahamut Versa's tremendous powers of rebirth and 
destruction threaten to bring utter ruin, the world's demise 
is averted—largely thanks to the work of one ever-reliable Astral.

Id's blade rings out with power as he drives it into his foe. Just 
then, massive blue wings unfurl, and Proto Bahamut lends its 
power to the crew. In that miraculous moment, the god of 
destruction is laid low.

Having accomplished indescribable deeds at the ends of the 
skies, the crew returns home. Id, now cut free from the past 
that bound him, vows to use his powers for good. Irreplacable 
friends by his side, he continues his journey through the blue skies.

Crew Alliance Rafale has posts all over the skies advertising
various job requests—and they're always on the look for 
skyfarers capable of helping out.

Rafale's Seedhollow branch is on the lookout for experienced
crews.

Even here in Folca,  finds Sierokarte of the
Knickknack Shack. Having aided the crew in past exploits,
she offers her help in this skydom.
Siero takes care of all your travel needs!
Sierokarte introduces the crew to the local blacksmith.

The crew rescues islanders from goblins and leaves them
with Rolan. They then hurry off to see if other settlements 
are also in need of assistance.
The crew finally exterminates the goblin forces.

The crew fall into a ravine where they're confronted by a
giant one-eyed monster.

The crew finally finds Lyria, but something seems amiss—she
doesn't react at all upon seeing  and Katalina.
All of a sudden, a mysterious attack shoots from Lyria's back. 
Historiath tries to fight back, but her attack is parried and
countered by Id. To the crew's confusion, Id appears in front
of Lyria—as if to protect her.
After an arduous battle, Managarmr is defeated and vanishes.

It turns out that the crew has been searching for a lost cat
this whole time.

The crew lands on Phondam. Seeing signs of a volcanic
eruption, possibly due to the primal beast's rampage,
they head off to rescue Lyria, making sure to have Rolan
take the Grandcypher to safety.

After a trying battle, the crew defeat Vulkan Bolla and rescues
Lyria. But before they can even breathe a sigh of relief, Avia's
leader Lilith appears. She snatches Lyria once more and
confronts the crew with overwhelming power.

After numerous fights, the crew finally catch up to Lilith. She
leaves Id to handle them and turns to open a gate to the Astral
Realm. But before she completes the ritual, Rolan launches a
surprise attack, disrupting her. In the commotion, both Astrals
and Lyria are thrown into the incomplete gate, leaving the crew
to fight Id alone.
Detailed records left by Rolan prior to the final battle.

A gateway in the skies is opened before the crew. Resolved to 
put an end to Lilith's machinations, they head toward the 
pillar's summit.

A malicious entity bearing a striking resemblance to Tempeal's
Furycane blocks the crew's path forward.

A malicious entity bearing a striking resemblance to
Mt. Neigelith's Managarmr blocks the crew's path forward.

A malicious entity bearing a striking resemblance to
Phondam's Vulkan Bolla blocks the crew's path forward.

The crew look forward to new adventures in a new skydom. 
However, Eugen reports wyverns are coming in fast.

When a flock of wyverns swarms the Grandcypher, 
and Lyria summon Bahamut. What should have been an easy
victory turns into a treacherous battle as a sudden madness
grips Bahamut, causing it to attack the crew.

Bahamut goes berserk and attacks the Grandcypher. Although
the ship escapes being sunk, it still takes considerable damage.
Vyrn's frantic calling rouses  from unconsciousness.

finds Lyria surrounded by monsters, and
the captain leaps to her aid.

Determined to save Lyria,  slays monster after 
monster with no end in sight.

When Vyrn hears a faraway voice that sounds like Rackam's,
he promptly yells out to it—only to have the crew suddenly
beset by a Quakadile that had been camouflaged as a rock.

The giant monster pushes  to the brink until 
Katalina, Io, and Rackam arrive to the rescue.

The crew seemingly takes down the Quakadile, only for 
it to get back up again. Luckily, Rosetta and Eugen arrive to 
provide some timely assistance.

The island's residents are under attack by goblins, and
many have yet to escape. Rolan is grateful for the crew's
formal offer to help and gives them a handmade
transceiver to keep in touch.

Goblins are abducting islanders from their homes. The crew
rushes to stop the kidnappers.
Rolan spots islanders attempting to flee from goblins.

The crew are afforded little respite; as soon as they defeat 
the initial wave, three large goblins appear and bar the 
way forward.
The crew arrives at the goblins' stronghold.

A formidable goblin confronts the crew inside the fortress.
He looks as tough as his shield.

Rolan waves goodbye to the crew as they head for the altar 
located in the mines of Tempeal.

Blown from the altar by a fierce gust, the crew spots a 
primal beast on a destructive rampage.

The primal beast destroys the crew's initial route forward,
forcing them to take a detour.

With their footing falling out from underneath them, 
the crew narrowly escape death and seek refuge in 
the mines.

The crew are forced to make a break for it with the primal
beast hot on their tails.

The crew shake off the pursuing primal beast and approach 
their target: the wind altar.

The primal beast Furycane appears before a wind-battered
crew. It brandishes its blade and charges.

The crew puts a stop to Furycane's rampage. Just as the storm
subsides and all seems well, a red ship appears from the cloud
cover. A curious group disembarks and encircles the crew. They 
try to take Lyria by force, but Katalina foils them. A mysterious
swordsman steps forward to ensure Lyria's capture.

The mysterious swordsman shrugs off the crew's 
attacks with unparalleled ease.

Mysteries pile up one after the other—why did the church 
kidnap Lyria? What caused Bahamut to go on a rampage? 
In the midst of this confusion, the crew sets sail for 
Leautagne to pursue the Church of Avia.

The crew destroys the energy regulator on one of Avia's
battleships, which sends it listing toward the bottom of the sky.

An Aviaeth battleship fires grapnels that latch onto the
Grandcypher to slow down the crew.

Four battleships box in the Grandcypher. Sinking the
battleships using the Grandcypher's ether cannons may be
the only way out of the blockade.

The crew destroys the energy regulator on one of Avia's
battleships, which sends it listing toward the bottom of the sky.

The crew safely escapes back to the Grandcypher after taking
down a battleship.

The crew destroys the energy regulator on one of Avia's
battleships, which sends it listing toward the bottom of the sky.

The crew safely escapes back to the Grandcypher after taking
down a battleship.
Gallanza of the Silver Wolf Corps

Just when the crew has the red ship cornered, a hulking man
with a massive spear comes flying aboard the Grandcypher.
He announces himself as Gallanza of the Silver Wolf Corps
and challenges the crew to a "deathmatch."

Braving the harsh snowstorm while avoiding icebergs, the
Grandcypher pursues the red ship to an icy mountain.

The crew makes an emergency landing at the foot of
Mt. Neigelith. Though they are all eager to go after
Lyria immediately, the Grandcypher has sustained
heavy damage. They leave repairs to Rolan and decide
to climb the mountain on foot.

Hordes of undead emerge and attack the crew, blocking 
their way.

The crew spot the monastery at the end of the bridge. While
crossing, however, they are ambushed by a familiar figure and
her posse, who destroy the bridge. Helpless, the crew fall into
ravine below.

A giant, one-eyed monster attacks the crew, unwittingly 
opening a hole in the wall for them to pass through.

Id takes 's attack head-on and then
counterattacks. This time,  withstands the
assault, which surprises Id ever so slightly.

Id takes 's attack head-on and then
counterattacks. This time,  withstands the
assault, which surprises Id ever so slightly.

In the midst of a fierce battle with Id, Lyria summons the
primal beast Managarmr.

The crew is saddened to see the fate that has befallen 
Lyria—brainwashed by the Church of Avia using a magical 
implement called a mind sealer. They head for Seedhollow 
to search for clues on how to undo the device's magic.

The crew fly to Dahli Island in search of a catalyst that 
will allow them to return Lyria to normal.

Numerous massive ruins dot the sandy island of Dahli, 
and one of them houses the catalyst the crew needs 
to help Lyria.

Following Zathba's guidance, the crew activates a switch. 
Before them now lies the sprawling, endless desert, which 
they gladly enter in search of the catalyst.

Upon arriving at Dahli's central set of ruins, the crew realizes
that a switch they had activated earlier has altered the ruins.

Upon arriving at Dahli's central set of ruins, the crew realizes
that a switch they had activated earlier has altered the ruins.

Upon arriving at Dahli's central set of ruins, the crew realizes
that a switch they had activated earlier has altered the ruins.

After activating all the switches, the box the crew had been 
looking for rises from the central ruins.

The crew has obtained the catalyst, but their joy is short-lived,
as a familiar enemy faction ambushes them once more. Their
leader, a haughty sorceress named Maglielle, introduces them
as the Sword Veil Fellowship before she orders them to attack.

The crew repels members of the Sword Veil, causing their
leader, Maglielle, to step in. Looking on in silent anger, she 
summons countless floating swords and engages the crew.

Primal beast Excavallion awakens and prepares to fire on
Zathba's ship. The ship avoids a direct hit thanks to Rolan
coming to their aid with the Grandcypher. The crew must
now bring down Excavallion.

A blast from Excavallion blows off the ether cannon of an
airship, and the cannon tumbles to the sand below.

The crew bring Excavallion to its knees, thus exposing its
core. Zathba and his fleet rain down cannon fire, but
a shield of sand seems to be protecting Excavallion 
from harm.

and the others climb up onto the inactive 
giant's back to reach the exposed core, but the primal 
beast reactivates, blowing them into the air with a strong 
gust. The crew narrowly dodges getting blasted and moves 
to go for a counterattack.

The crew unleashes a powerful blow to Excavallion's face,
causing it to fall to its knees once more.

With the catalyst in hand, the next step is to recover Lyria from
Avia. The crew sets a course for Phondam.

The crew finally spots the red ship among Phondam's 
boiling landscape.

The crew arrives at a flaming altar, where they find Id facing
off with a primal beast which seems to have trapped Lyria
within a crystal atop its crown. When it flees into its volcanic
lair, the crew gives chase.

When Vyrn sees that Vulkan Bolla has been stunned, he tries
to use the catalyst to free Lyria from her prison atop the
primal's head. However, Vulkan Bolla resists.

Id thwarts Vulkan Bolla's attacks on the crew. Though 
formerly their enemy, he now calls for a temporary truce.

This time with the help of Id, Vyrn uses the catalyst
once more. At last, cracks begin to appear in the crystal 
that holds Lyria captive.

Vulkan Bolla has nowhere else to run and is subdued by 
the crew. Vyrn seizes the chance to use the catalyst once 
more, this time actually succeeding: Lyria is freed from 
the crystal.

Rolan reveals that he, like Lilith, is an Astral. The crew are
shocked by the revelation, but the arrival of a swarm of Avia
vessels gives them precious little time to adjust. Instead, they
hurriedly prepare for battle.

Rolan proclaims that while he may be an astral, he still 
wants to help protect the denizens of the Sky Realm. In 
order to do that, he and the crew will need to go to 
Seedhollow to stop Lilith.

Aviaeth forces have invaded Seedhollow, throwing the 
city into chaos.

To stop Lilith's plot and save their precious Lyria, the
crew enters Seedhollow Castle, which has become
embroiled in the flames of war.

A zealous Aviaeth unit led by Inquisitor Rook arrives on the
battlefield to stop the crew.

The crew are stopped in their tracks by Reaper Avalan and
his unit. These soldiers will give everything, even their lives,
to hold back the crew.

Two units of Tayu'itar are airdropped from Aviaeth ships 
onto the battlefield. Rolan repurposes a defeated Tayu'itar 
for the crew's use.

An unavoidable and inescapable battle with Gallanza and
Maglielle unfolds inside the castle.

Gallanza and Maglielle suffer defeat at the crew's hands. They
ask to exchange their lives for the safety of their troops, but
the crew have no intention of killing anyone.

As a fierce battle erupts between the crew and Id,
the Aviaeth swordsman questions whether the crew can 
truly protect Lyria.

As a fierce battle erupts between the crew and Id,
the Aviaeth swordsman questions whether the crew can 
truly protect Lyria.
Id and the crew exchange vicious, unrelenting blows.
Id and the crew exchange vicious, unrelenting blows.

The battle against Id ramps up in intensity, with 
both sides utterly unwilling to yield.

The battle against Id ramps up in intensity, with 
both sides utterly unwilling to yield.

Id uses the dragon power welling inside him to push
the crew back a with a barrage of attacks—though 
their spirit is not yet broken.

Id uses the dragon power welling inside him to push
the crew back a with a barrage of attacks—though 
their spirit is not yet broken.

Id fights furiously against the crew, but eventually his
dragon power flames out, and he falls to his knees 
in defeat.

Panic ensues in Seedhollow as the sky becomes an 
abnormal color and the Pillar of Vayoi appears.

It becomes clear to the crew that if they fail to stop Lilith's 
evil machinations, it could spell the end of the skies. 
They make for the Pillar of Vayoi.
The crew set foot upon the Pillar of Vayoi.

Lyria summons Furycane for help, which ends in failure. 
Id appears in the nick of time to fight off the primal beast.
With Id's help, the crew defeats Furycane Nihilla.
With Gallanza's help, the crew defeats Managarmr Nihilla.

Maglielle saves the crew from a fiery end, but there's no time
to relax before the next threat is upon them.
With Maglielle's help, the crew defeats Vulkan Bolla Nihilla.

With help from Gallanza and Maglielle, the crew reach the top
of the Pillar of Vayoi. There, they find Lilith overjoyed to at last
be opening the gate to the Astral Realm. Lilith leaves no room
for discussion—she activates Angra Mainyu, forcing the crew
to challenge the beast once more.

Through sheer will, the crew severely wounds Angra Mainyu. 
Left with few options, Lilith chooses to fuse with the primal 
beast, creating a being of immense power.

The crew vows to save the newly-transformed Id. 
They set off to chase after the dragon of destruction.

The crew manage to hold back Bahamut Versa with Rolan's
sealing spell. Determined to bring Id back, they engage in
the final battle.

The dragon of destruction attempts to reenter the 
Sky Realm through a dimensional tear.

Sensing the crew's presence, Bahamut Versa attacks. 
Within the rift, the two Bahamuts become locked in a 
battle of devastating proportions.

Though Bahamut Versa's tremendous powers of rebirth and 
destruction threaten to bring utter ruin, the world's demise 
is averted—largely thanks to the work of one ever-reliable Astral.

Meeting Lyria was the beginning of your journey to the ends of the 
sky. Now, with your friends and fellow crew members, a new 
adventure awaits in the yet-unexplored western skies.

Barely conscious,  catches a glimpse of the past—of
saving Lyria and suffering a fatal wound, then of Lyria sharing
her own life to save .

Barely conscious,  catches a glimpse of the past—of
saving Lyria and suffering a fatal wound, then of Lyria sharing
her own life to save .

A young boy's memories in the sky... He was lost in the
depths of despair, but her gesture was a lie. Lilith had only
used Id as a vessel to seal Bahamut. Turned inhuman and
overtaken by a destructive will, Id casts off even Lilith, who
he'd revered as a mother, and flees into the void.

Minutes of Committee Meeting #131
 
1. Status Update
Probe team delivered a presentation on the impact of each
island's primal beast. Results show the evolutionary sequence
of the "skydwellers" in the survey zone has reached 80%.
 
2. Motion to Advance Project
Members deliberated on the merits of proceeding with the
project based on the status update given. A vote was held.
The yeas have it by an overwhelming majority.
 
3. Phase Two Approved
Project Affinity has been greenlit.
 
Note 1: Our team was tasked with researching "emotional
intelligence." Project Affinity aims to reveal aspects of its
inner workings. The project focuses on studying the broad,
long-term effects of the skydweller construct known as "faith."
 
Note 2: The "Avia proposal" seeks to install primal beasts as
the foundation of faith, which may further spur evolution of
the system. Proposal is currently under review.
 
Astraeus

Research Log: DZ-AM-A-2307
 
In the decade since Aviaeth dogma was established, the
number of followers worshipping the primal beasts as
primeval gods has grown rapidly. They flock to this house of
worship erected upon a small island in the Ainsteddo
Archipelago.
 
During my deployment to the holy site, I encountered a
skydweller calling himself Aldo. He was an especially
fervent believer, even by Aviaeth standards, and he was
well-regarded by his brethren. 
 
On one occasion, Aldo shouted, "Leave it to Mr. Fix It!"
before racing far north to exterminate monsters. He did this
without seeking reward, intending only to ease the concerns
of residents in the southern reaches. To borrow skydweller
parlance, he was a "nice guy." I must admit his actions
baffled me; I suppose that's what intrigued me.
 
The curiosity of this professed handyman knew no limits.
Because I was an off-islander, he questioned me incessantly
about other islands—about their food, culture, music, and
monsters.
 
Aldo always roped me into errands that demanded my
swordsmanship, yet I never felt compelled to help against my
will. Dealing with him was like a breath of fresh air for an
Astral like me.
 
Astonishing. It seems even I am not immune to the influence
of "emotional intelligence." I will note any further changes
in my behavior as my conversations with Aldo continue.
 
Astraeus

Aldo is dead.
 
Death is merely a statistic. I have observed it time and
again over my research career. Then why do I feel distress
over the loss of one meaningless skydweller? What is
happening to me? Someone release me from this pain!
 
We were exterminating monsters in Skywyrm Valley when a
wyvern ambushed me from behind. Upon turning, there was
Aldo, impaled by talons meant for me. The fool! Why
sacrifice yourself to save another?
 
Skydwellers have short lifespans, thus it is imperative
they live to ensure the survival of their progeny. Now Aldo's
young child must endure without their father. What am I to do?
 
After the funeral, Aldo's spouse presented me with a book.
It was his journal—a record of our conversations. He logged
all I had taught him, down to the last detail. It seemed he
had nothing but praise for me, but why?
 
You were the one who gave your all for the sake of others.
You were the exceptional one.
 
Aldo is never coming back. Memories of the past stab at me.
I cannot fathom this sense of loss, nor this fluid that wets
my cheeks...
 
Though one thing is certain—something has changed in me. I
can carry on his legacy by taking up his mantle. My plan to
retire among the skydwellers upon the end of this project
shall have to wait, but it doesn't matter. I must protect
the skies Aldo loved so much.
 
From this day forth, I shall relinquish my Astral name in
favor of one befitting the skies. Aldo, wherever you are,
please watch over me.
 
Rolan

The worst has come to pass.
 
I've uncovered disturbing facts behind last week's incident
on Dahli Island—what some have dubbed the Dahli Catastrophe.
All the explosives and mages in this skydom combined
couldn't have produced such untold destruction. Surely the
Astral power lying dormant in Dahli was merged and
misappropriated.
 
I hurried to Hollowhaze Altar under Seedhollow Castle to
confirm my fears. Primal beast Angra Mainyu, who'd been
sealed away five hundred years ago during the War, was
indeed gone. I could only think of one person with reason to
wreak havoc using Angra Mainyu: Lilith.
 
On the bright side, it seems her experiment failed somehow.
I thought the entire research division had returned to the
Astral Realm at War's end, but evidently she stayed behind.
To keep researching in secret perhaps? I can only speculate.
 
Either way, Lilith won't be deterred by a setback. The window
for returning to the Astral Realm has closed, and now
Angra Mainyu is her only ticket home. Alas, the fallout from
the mass consumption of primal crystals it would take to
open such a gate would wipe Zegagrande off the map.
 
I failed to save Dahli, but there's no time to lament my
inefficacy. No doubt Lilith will soon mobilize to recharge
Angra's depleted energy.
 
It won't be easy facing a primal that can manipulate
dimensions at Lilith's beck and call. I need a plan—a really
good one—or else it could trap me in an alternate dimension
forever.
 
Rolan

A decade after the Dahli Catastrophe, Lilith is finally
making her move.
 
She's co-opted the Aviaeth ideology that I created,
rebranding her group as the Pilgrims of Avia. Painting the
Dahli disaster as divine retribution was a shrewd way to
bring fearful pawns under her thumb.
 
Well, she's not the only one gathering allies. I've made
plenty of friends too, and my trials into countering Angra
Mainyu's dimension-hopping are going smoothly. I devised a
tracking device that uses the coordinates of newly formed
dimensions to triangulate the root dimension. As long as
someone has the device with them, they can—in theory—be
retrieved from any dimension. Still, this is Lilith we're
talking about. I have to wait for the right time to strike.
 
Has it really been half a millennium since I pledged to
watch over the skydwellers? You know, Aldo, I've come to
understand why you risked your life. It was emotional
intelligence—the very thing I was brought to the Sky Realm
to study. Call it a miracle that manifests when all seems
lost. The skydwellers of Zegagrande have made so much
progress thanks to this innate trait. My final task is to clean
up the mess my brethren made.
 
Who knows? If I come out of this alive, maybe I'll
assimilate with the Sky Realm and become a skydweller in
the literal sense. To eat what skydwellers eat, to pass the
years as they do, and to finally shuffle off this mortal coil.
My long, long journey is drawing to a close. I'll be seeing
you, old friend.
 
Rolan

Has it only been a few days since I started traveling with
's crew? After all the craziness we've been through,
it definitely feels longer.
 
Right off the bat, I got the sense that  was
gracious beyond reason. The good captain reminds me so much
of Aldo.
 
Of course, I haven't forgotten my promise to pay it
forward. Until I draw my last breath, I will protect this
world and all its amazing inhabitants.
 
Rolan

If you're reading this, then I guess something must've
happened to me. Lilith is powerful to say the least.
Anything short of a perfect plan won't be without its
losses, but if sacrifices must be made, I want to be the
only one to take the fall.
 
So with that out of the way, I'd like to make an apology.
 
The truth is, I used . I couldn't go up against
Lilith, not while she commanded the church. I needed my own
pieces. When I saw 's combat skills in Tempeal,
I knew I was in luck.
 
I also knew you'd carry on the fight against Lilith should
I fail. Your crew's devotion to each other is the pillar that
bolsters 's resolve. There's no evil that can
sever your bonds. That's clear to me now more than ever. I
was wrong to keep you in the dark.
 
Six hundred years ago, I promised to protect all skydwellers.
After meeting you and your crew, it further proved I was right
to side with the skies. Traveling with everyone over these past
days reminded me of cherished bygone memories.
 
It's been an honor adventuring with you all. Thank you for
everything.
 
Sincerely,
Rolan, Folca's Mr. Fix It

My worst fears are beginning to manifest. Lilith continues to
make progress on the resurrection of Angra Mainyu—a fact
which she is trying to conceal. I intend to do everything in my
power to thwart her ambitions, but the outlook is grim. I must
prepare for the worst case scenario.

I have managed to find a glimmer of hope in all this, however—
I've finally completed the transmitter device. Even if Angra
Mainyu manages to spirit me away into another dimension,
the transmitter should act as a cross-dimensional beacon—so
long as its pair unit finds itself in similar relative coordinates...
What's more, if I make use of the magic Lilith developed
from her painstaking research on Angra Mainyu, I should be
able to contrive a means of opening a gate.

This plan is far from flawless, however. The gate-opening spell
is theoretically immaculate, yes, but it remains... finnicky.
Performing it in a sub-optimal environment could result in failure.
No, the irony of using a spell derived from Angra Mainyu against
the very creature is not lost on me.

To avoid suspicion, I've installed the device—and some spares to
boot—within my other notable handywork: the transceivers. In
addition to the one in my possession, Historiath, Zathba, and Vyrn
should also have one at their disposal. Skydwellers recognize the
enormous value of these devices, so they should treat them with
great care... One can only hope.

My only remaining concerns are with my own strength—I'm
frankly unsure if I have what it takes to stand against Lilith. But if
it's for the sake of these skies, and for its beautiful denizens, I'll
have to try.

Aldo... Watch over them for me, won't you?

 Rolan

Research Log: DZ-RR-L-0001

I am on the cusp of returning to the Astral Realm with our
results on skydweller evolution. Having reconstituted
skydweller society to the same level of a world in second
incarnation, my team is free to execute Project Affinity. At
last I can plumb the depths of "emotional intelligence."
Flaunting my connections has worked wonders for procuring
project approval. Who says politics and academics do not
mix?

They have no idea Project Affinity is a sham. My true
objective mustn't fail. But in the event of the unforeseen,
my manifesto below shall remain.
---
The Utopia Initiative—I shall stand above all as the
eternal mark of reverence, the conductor of all souls past,
present, and future. Achieving my ambition requires
unlocking the secrets of the heart. Said data shall be
collected from the "faith" trials. Secrecy is of the utmost
importance.

First I ingratiate myself with the skydweller test
subjects. In time, a gate shall be opened to the Holy Seat
of Genesis, Estalucia—where the concept of dimensions
becomes nebulous. Opening the gate necessitates the creation
of a special primal beast.

I, Lilith, am destined to become the one and only shepherd.
No being shall repudiate me, not even the Creator. Absolute
salvation hinges on the initiative's success.

Note: Some claim researcher L engages in suspect work
pertaining to the Creator. It matters not so long as my plan
succeeds first, though I should keep an eye on him.

Research Log: DZ-RR-L-0004
 
My team has arrived in the survey zone. Primitive
skydweller civilization needs further cultivation. Deploying
the primal beasts to the main islands should accomplish
that.
 
Work has begun on the great primal beast Angra Mainyu.
Angra is the key to reaching the Holy Seat of Genesis,
Estalucia. The Sky Realm-Estalucia bridge has a mere 0.2%
chance of success at connecting compared to 64% for the
Astral Realm-Estalucia bridge. In theory, the rate can
increase to 89% by exceeding Angra's limits. Hence I must
hurry back to the Astral Realm as soon as this research is
over.
 
The High Council imposed usage restrictions after Angra was
found to consume more primal crystals than anticipated in
certain cases. Luckily the inquiry ended without escalation
once I classified Angra Mainyu as "a system for returning to
the Astral Realm."
 
Research into emotional intelligence hums along without end
in sight. Since proof of its origin continues to elude me, I
must treat it as a product of the divine.

Research Log: DZ-RR-L-2443
 
Five centuries ago, we Astrals failed to subjugate the
skydwellers primarily because the primal beasts were sealed
away by a certain individual. The excursion in the survey zone
was terminated, and the entire research team returned home.
Except me. I finally discovered where Angra was hidden, and
now it is mine.
 
Finding Angra within a skydweller citadel felt like an insult, but
my biggest concern was the dragon that manifested when
Angra opened the gate. I had heard that the sky's Bahamut
responded to Astral energy, but I paid it no heed until it was
too late. If there is a silver lining, all my research would have
been for naught had I not found a suitable vessel to trap
Bahamut.
 
The cursed dragon's opposition rendered Dahli barren, and
Angra expended much energy in the clash. I shall return
Angra to its altar and await its recovery.
 
I have completed my investigation into emotional intelligence.
All that is left is to return to the Astral Realm, and then onward
to Estalucia. The dragon's vessel—Id—is in stable condition.
If I can maintain that stability, the dragon ought to trouble me no
more.
 
Now, I must devise a way to harvest the power of other primal
beasts to hasten Angra's recovery.

Research Log: DZ-RR-L-2451
 
Angra Mainyu can absorb the survey zone's primal beasts on
two conditions: One, the primals are released from their
seals. Two, a suitable vessel exists to store their power.
 
Who knew the Aviaeth ideology that Astraeus created could
still serve a purpose after all this time? Many who had lost
their faith in the wake of the Dahli incident were persuaded
to return under new pretenses. Our numbers swelled. The
Pilgrims of Avia is my vehicle for traversing the skydom
freely. At this rate I shall have all the pieces I need to agitate
the primal beasts. None will dare take up arms against my
own well-equipped forces.
 
That leaves fulfilling the second condition.

Research Log: DZ-RR-L-3237
 
All of my labors have paid off. The Pilgrims of Avia now
brandish might rivaling that of a national army. And Id.
Precious Id. He is so devoted to me. His training with the
generals has awoken his ability to channel the dragon's
power within him, at least to a small degree. It is too late
for the skydwellers to oppose me; my forces led by the
generals will grind them into dust should they have the
audacity to resist.
 
One of Angra's tendrils delivered welcome news. While
scouting another skydom, it had discovered the girl in blue,
a mortal with the ability to harvest primal power. It seems
she belongs to a skyfaring crew capable of crossing skydoms.
Perhaps dangling Sky Map pieces in front of their faces will
entice them to come to Zegagrande. Once they arrive, I
must simply wait for the girl in blue to fall under Angra's
influence.
 
A warm welcome awaits her—our Shaman of Salvation. Yes...
Salvation is at hand...

Hi, .
 
Just thought I'd give you a primer on caring for the sword
and armor I gave you. I crafted them a long time ago using
special metal alloys (sorry, that's a trade secret). I'm
confident my pieces will withstand a ton of punishment but
only if you observe proper maintenance.
 
Let's start with the sword. It'll get chipped in tough
battles, there's no way around it. You probably already knew
this, but keep the blade sharpened. Any old whetstone will
do, so long as you're gentle. After that, you should treat
the blade with high-quality camellia oil produced by the
smithies in Seedhollow. It's not cheap, but it's worth the
price. Finally, don't forget to wipe off excess oil with an
antique cloth.
 
Now for the armor. Frequent polishing with oil and a metal
brush is a must. The exterior is chemically treated with
melamite to prevent rust, but that coating can get scraped
off in extreme combat. Scrub off any rust immediately with a
metal brush and oil, or else it'll spread like mold. Oh, and
make sure it's Dahli 566. That's a high-performing
all-purpose oil that was manufactured on Dahli Island,
though no one knows how to make it anymore. I got you
started with a small bottle, but you ought to stock up from
a trader if you can.
 
If you need additional help, take your gear to a smithy in
Folca or Seedhollow. It's not free, of course, but some
situations call for an expert's touch.

Cannon Work Order
 
 To: Folca Shipyard
 
I've delivered the four cannons Rolan requested. He left a
special message for the engineers, so have them take a look
beforehand, okay?
 
Yours Truly,
Sierokarte
***
 
Some manufacturers endorse the "bigger guns, deadlier ship"
trend. People were blown away (no pun intended) by the huge
ether artillery models that entered last year's market. This
creates a vicious feedback loop: ships pack on more armor
and bulk to protect against heavier shells, guns get bigger
to compensate, and costs go up across the board.
 
Enter the latest model of carronade-style ether cannons,
which crams the same firepower into a compact, sleek design
that facilitates longer sustained fire. They're also easier
to install and maintain. So although smaller ships have less
armor and smaller payloads, a fleet of speedy fighters can
rule the skies through maneuverability and numbers.
 
Obviously a cannon is pointless if it blows up its user.
Thanks to alloys of red gigas steel and damascus grains,
these gun batteries won't explode even if the ship goes up
in flames. They also have built-in fail-safes in case of
overheating.
 
By the very nature of being mechanics, I know some of you
don't have a positive opinion of ether cannons. Weapons are
weapons; that's completely understandable. However,
considering how essential an airship is, I believe some form
of self-defense is deserved. I assure you, we'll only use
them for protection. Thank you for understanding.
 
Rolan

Glow Up! How to Dress for Success
 
So once again, flowers are in full bloom all over Seedhollow.
(Seriously though, it's the city of everlasting spring. What
did you expect?) Don't get me wrong, I love our little natural
air fresheners, but why should they grab all the eyeballs?
Become an attention magnet with this season's hotness: 
monochromatic colors!
 
A well-coordinated, monotone ensemble of unbranded pieces
will do more for your style and confidence than playing the
fashion name game. Dump the cheugy labels (they're boring!),
and show off the new you! Bonus points if you pair your fit
with a statement bag!
 
So what're you waiting for? Come check out the hidden gems
down in the Third District!

Meow's it going, kitty lovers? In this issue, we're reporting
on news from Seedhollow, home to the largest population
of our feline friends in Zegagrande!
  
Meet Mythy, the flower capital's boss cat. His fur is as
black as the night. Mythy rules with purrfect leadership
over all the other cats that stalk the back alleys. I know
the urge to pet him is hard to resist, but trust me—you're
safer admiring this prideful top cat from afar.
  
Next we have Ciari, a solitary white fluffball who loves
crawling into hard-to-reach places. Some call Ciari a bearer
of good fortune. If you ever catch sight of this elusive
girl, some of her luck might even rub off on you.
  
Finally, I'd lose my cat lovers card if I didn't mention Sparkles.
This affectionate creature boasts a 30,000% success rate of
capturing anyone's attention. I'm a huge fan myself. Just
between you and me, she works as a greeter at a certain
shop in town... Just thinking about it is making me...
  
Sorry, everyone! I need my Sparkles fix, stat!

Things started off weird from day one. I'd feel this
unmistakable sense of dread from time to time. Probably just
the heat, right? I tried to brush it off, but the gnawing
fear grew stronger every day. Is there something... deep
down below us? I'm not claiming to have seen ghosts, but
it's like I can't get away from this cold hand that keeps
running its fingers down my spine. The specter of death
looms over my head.
 
Man, I wish I hadn't taken this gig. Just let me finish my
contract so I can finally climb out of this boiling pot.

The primal beast of vitality.
 
When Furycane descended upon Ainsteddo Archipelago, it
blessed Tempeal's geology, combining the natural elements of
wind and fire to create abundant minerals, which in turn led
to innovations in smithing techniques.
 
Over time, with primal and man working and living in tandem,
Tempeal became known as the holy forge of smithing.

We—and by we I mean everyone in Zegagrande—think of you
folks as our guests of honor. So get your missing friend
back, and come home alive. I've got some fine jobs and some
finer beverages with your names on 'em.
 
Zathba

Wow! Did you know that my sleepy little diner was the first
restaurant the saviors of Zegagrande ever visited? Well,
guess what fueled them on their journey? That's right; our
one-of-a-kind Folca barley soup!
 
Their adventures were fraught with many trials. I heard how

1024th Folca Town Hall Meeting
 
First Item: Next year's human resources officer

The current human resources director has agreed to stay on.
 
Second Item: Long-term closure of Rolan's business

Rolan's handyman operations will remain closed for as long
as his whereabouts are unknown. Considering his experience,
from airship repairs to monster exterminations, many
residents want answers in the wake of his absence. The
chairperson will handle some of these queries personally due
to the seriousness of the situation.
 
Addendum: After deliberating with the chairperson, we will
ask a certain crew to attend to the most pressing issues.

The Church of Avia destroyed large sections of Seedhollow
Castle, but we can and will rebuild.
 
Merchants, laborers, skyfarers, nobles, and fair citizens,
we ask now for your contributions so that we may immediately
begin the restoration process.
 
A special thanks to the merchant guild, for swiftly taking
initiative in planning the reconstruction festival and acting as 
intermediaries with public works officials. Your efforts are
greatly recognized and appreciated.
 
People of Seedhollow, let us join hands to rebuild the symbol
of our fair city as soon as possible!

Join the Force
 
Remnants of Avia's forces still lurk in Zegagrande. Now YOU
can help keep the people of Seedhollow safe by enlisting in
the volunteer corps. Candidates with previous military
experience have the opportunity to enroll in the officer
program.
 
Any aspiring soldiers itching to fight alongside their fellow
comrades are more than welcome. The training will not be
easy, but every recruit is guaranteed a warm bed and a
filling meal.
 
Help us build a world where we can all live in peace!

Let's Heal as a Community
 
These are tough times for all of us. While it will take
many months, maybe even years, of hard work to restore
the castle to its former glory, the lives lost in the attack can
never be returned.
 
Yet we as survivors must look to the future, especially if
our children are to live their days in happiness. For their
sakes and ours, we must move forward with smiles on our
faces. This festival was organized to soothe broken hearts
and frayed nerves.
 
Enjoy food and shopping from a plethora of participating
businesses. The soldiers will hold a parade to commemorate
the fallen.
 
Our hearts need healing. Come recuperate as a community,
and celebrate as we officially begin the reconstruction of
Seedhollow Castle.

Id challenged  to a sword match today. It was like
watching two acrobats dancing on the battlefield. All I could
do was keep my worries to myself and cheer them on.
They looked so serious... Could they even hear me? But you
know, I think they were having fun too.
 
I told Katalina about the duel later on. She said, "A clash
of swords can impart more than words ever can." I guess
 and Id were bonding in their own way. I'm
actually a tiny bit jealous. Maybe if I keep bugging Katalina,
she'll teach me how to use a sword?

The truth must be told.
 
I was given the honor of tasting a dessert made by the knight
who took down a wraithwing. I remember taking a bite, and
then my world became fuzzy. At first I thought I'd lost my
sense of taste until a tidal wave of flavor overloaded my tongue
and a sandy texture began to expand in my mouth. It was like
experiencing a new dimension of gastronomic proportion, and
I knew...
 
That was it. My tongue had died and gone to the Estalucia
of flavor.
 
...Or maybe basic food safety was ignored. Who's to say?

The Nautilus Enters Service
 
Today, the new and improved Nautilus officially commences
its route between Folca and Seedhollow. Test flights have
demonstrated that the Nautilus can reach three times the
cruising speed of conventional passenger ships. In other
words, the Folca-Seedhollow journey which once took three
days can now be completed in just one.
 
We sincerely apologize for any inconvenience caused by the
lack of transportation services while the Nautilus was being
refurbished. We would also like to take this opportunity to
thank the lead engineer, Kent, and the entire refurbishment
team for their hard work on this project.
 
Folca Air Travel Association

Folca Medical Clinic Will See You Now!
 
Thanks to the generous donations we've received, Folca
Medical Clinic is proud to open its doors to serve the
community. This wouldn't have been possible without your
valuable contributions. Thank you all from the bottom of our
hearts.
 
With our new and improved equipment and staff, we are now
able to accept emergency visits as well as provide house calls
in the evenings. Our enhanced system for rotating attending 
physicians means everyone gets the speedy care they need in
case of emergencies.
 
Protecting your health is our highest priority. If you're not
feeling well for any reason, please stop by for a friendly
consultation.

Yes! The eryngiums I planted in that pot of Tempeal dirt
finally bloomed today. What a huge step forward! Now I feel
like I can really cut loose with my gardening. Just you wait
Tempeal. I'll raise purple anemones out of your earth if it's
the last thing I do. I swear it'd be easier to teach a goblin
how to dance though.
 
Speaking of teaching half-witted creatures, I wonder if that
lunkhead understood what I was getting at when I mentioned
the symbolism behind anemones. Probably not. He wouldn't
notice a rock if it hit him in the face.
 
But that's all right. I have my dream, and he has his. All we
can do is reach for them.
 
But until then, I'll keep on waiting. As long as we're together
in the end, I can wait—no matter how long it takes.

Lo, the lady beareth blossoms upon her crown.
An apostle of god, or the primeval itself?
Shouldst thou be visited by her fortune,
Approach no closer. Speak not a sound.
Witness her resplendence, as nature wills.
Like the butterfly who flutters free, 
Or the flower that reacheth for the heavens, 
Witness her, as if she were the sky or the stars.
Only then will she offer her grace,
Where fields once wilted rise lush, and gardens bloom unbound.
And for her mercy, offer thy prayers of gratitude each day.
Forget not our goddess of fertility, who blesseth this land.

From "The Grosgard Family History", page 1
 
To future generations of my kin,
 
For our role in preserving supply lines during the War, it is
said that the Crown of Seedhollow granted us our namesake
domain that we now guide and protect. Truth be told, the
royal family from that time has ceased to exist, and we are
now lords by way of custom only.
 
As protector of this land, you must endeavor to make
appropriate decisions. You have a duty to lead the people
fairly and ensure peace reigns across the dukedom.
 
If you neglect your responsibility, however, you risk losing
our ancestral lands—and more importantly, the vassals who 
inhabit those lands. Such fair men and woman, who have
stood loyally by our sides for all these generations, do not
deserve such a fate.
 
You must learn to make the correct decision, as a great
many fates rest in your palms. As such, the location of our
family sword is recorded here... If you wish to obtain the
fabled blade of your forebears, prove yourself a worthy lord
protector.
 
Erwin, Fifth Lord of Grosgard

Attention all Defense Corps members,
 
An organization is only as strong as its members. You may
be called upon to defend your home from threats ranging from
bandits to monsters. The Corps shoulders the burden of the
town's safety, and to that end, each person must perform
this program every other day.
 
 • 150+ push-ups
 • 150+ sit-ups
 • 300+ hip hinges
 • 500+ sword swings
 • Long-distance running until you collapse
 
There is no shame in missing these targets at the outset.
What matters is that you beat your personal best the
following session. The goals I have laid out require effort
to achieve, but I have faith that each and every one of you
will succeed.
 
Percival, Provisional Captain

Evaluation of Seedhollow and its Armed Forces
 
I found the opportunity to conduct reconnaissance within
Seedhollow, the largest city-state in Zegagrande Skydom, and
its military. I am ready to report my findings. Seedhollow's
principal industries are agriculture (specifically horticulture)
and mining. The nation has enjoyed a long period of peace,
thus its military strength is still emerging. Nevertheless, each
soldier is ready to give their life in defense of their homeland.
The cheerful disposition of the citizens reflects their trust in
their protectors.
 
I, Siegfried, attest with conviction that Seedhollow poses no
threat to Feendrache. It is my personal recommendation that
we establish diplomatic relations at once to exchange resources
and personnel for the benefit of both nations.

This Month's Newest Discoveries

Bravescale
Scientific Name: Dinichthys Granpisces

Bravescale are large fish distinguishable by their jointed
necks. They often stick out of wagon carts due to their long
length. This species was discovered by the Fishergod, a
legendary angler known to those in Zegagrande's fishing
circles. He has made a massive contribution to the
advancement of marine life classification, and we can't wait
to see what else he discovers.
 
Jewelfin
Scientific Name: Cretoxyrhina Varia

A cartilaginous fish belonging to the elasmobranchii
subclass. Its name is derived from the prismatic display of
color as light reflects off of its scales. Long rumored to
exist but never proven, it was finally spotted by a traveler
named Yodarha.
 
Zegagrande Marine Research Publishing

Monster populations will return eventually, but for now, the

"I am Ghandagoza, the unrivaled master of Eternal Rage!"
 
His proclamation reverberated across three skydoms and over
seven mountain ranges, signaling the rise of a battle fury
the world has never seen.
 
"No one can survive my Fist of the Red Lotus!"
 
—Now you know of the legend.

This is an oil painting done by a sickly girl.
 
A faint hint of sunlight breaks through plump, black rain
clouds. It is like a glimmer of hope piercing the shadow of
despair. A young man bathes in the light. He cries at the
sky for freedom, his arms spread wide as he pours his heart
to the world. Is he happy? Is he sad? He is both. Joy is
liberation; sorrow, more so. As long as we breathe, we
cannot truly relieve ourselves of obstacles, for one barrier
obscures another. And yet the boy continues to bellow for
freedom, as if his cries could burst out of the painting and
transfer his thirst for life to the observer.

This is a one of a kind portrait of a young girl.
 
She smiles quietly in the early afternoon sun, her golden
locks riding the wind. Such innocence, such grace—such
charm, poise, and elegance—this piece depicts a figure of
otherworldly refinement. But where does she gaze? What
memory is she reliving to elicit this joy? Such beauty is
only possible in the realm of imagination. No model could
possibly be that eternally cute... could they?
 
Among art dealers, this painting exists solely in description,
as only a lucky few were able to steal a glimpse before it
went off the market. Consequently, it has become something
of a myth around Zegagrande's galleries—though, legend or
not, all can agree on one point: only a modern master could
have rendered such an image.

The primal beast of sequestration.
 
Managarmr possesses the ability to force mortals into a
sense of wariness, effectively keeping them at a distance.
It was placed atop the sacred mountain on Leautagne Island,
where its abilities would ward skydwellers away from the
harsh, freezing conditions of the area. Later, skydwellers
would go on to develop a new faith based on the primal's
"divine" interdictions.

The primal beast of fortification.
 
Armed with the ability to absorb sandstone, Excavallion is
able to transform itself into a nigh impregnable fortress.
Originally established as a stronghold to protect Almerain
Island, it was transferred to Dahli Island after the local
populace was nearly wiped out. Once there, it served as a
refugee shelter.
 
Afterward it became a bustling home for the surviving Dahli
residents and was named Holy City Vallion. However, Rolan
sealed away Excavallion some five hundred years ago during
the War, depriving the people of their societal bedrock.
According to ongoing research conducted by Seedhollow
scholars, the destruction wrought by the Dahli Catastrophe
fifteen years ago is the reason why only pockets of ruins
remain.

The primal beast of dread.
 
In reality, Vulkan Bolla's molten body has no definitive
shape. Instead, it can assume the form of one's worst fears.
Indeed, it once absorbed the dread of the entire population
of Dahli, causing its body to morph uncontrollably until it
burst and scorched the land.
 
Due to its amorphous state, efforts to enshrine the primal
failed, and it now reigns over a broken and abandoned land.

decided upon the battleground that is the Pillar of Vayoi.

The party fights off Furycane's shadow with Id's support.
Id hardens his resolve to stop Lilith, and the sincerity of
his words resonates with , who decides to
accept him.

Riding the Grandcypher, the crew chases Id, who has
transformed into Bahamut Versa. Rolan says that if Versa
is left unchecked, the world will be destroyed—to which
 responds: "Not gonna happen!"

A heated battle behind them, the crew return to Folca.
This time, they're accompanied by Id, who gloomily 
inquires after Rolan—only to suddenly take off on his own.

After Id's first job, the islander thanks him and the crew,
hoping to receive his help again in the future. Id believes
he would have been rejected on his own, and expresses
his gratitude to . Seeing his overly stiff
behavior, the crew worries it may take some time for him
to become popular like Rolan.

Id is settling into his job as a handyman and getting
used to people. One day, he receives a job from an
unexpected client: a soldier at Seedhollow Castle, whom
he had once fought against with Avia. According to the
soldier, a strange shadow has appeared at the Pillar of
Vayoi that the army can't handle. Id agrees to stop it
before it can pose a threat.

Id vanquishes the shadow, but expects to be charged,
even arrested for having been a member of Avia.
However, the soldier offers thanks as a representative
of Seedhollow. Viewing him as a handyman diligently
doing good for the people of the city, the soldier sees
no need to arrest Id. The soldier leaves, and the other 
islanders express gratitude for Id's help.
Where There's a Will, There's a Way

Rolan's journal entries that were left behind may provide
clues for his rescue. Id believes that he may be able to
use the power within him to open a gate to the
dimensional rift, reaching Rolan. The crew decides to
once again head to the place where they faced
off against Bahamut Versa.

Nothing gets past Sierokarte. As soon as she sees the
upgraded weapon in 's possession, she
recognizes it can still be pushed to higher potentials.

Dear ,
I always knew you were special, but your
perseverance never ceases to amaze me. Most would
balk at the prospect of confronting a dragon, yet
you did so twice! I just hope this nausea from the
dimensional time lag subsides soon... Ah, but
that's neither here nor there. You've returned me
to my beloved Folca—there's only one thing left
for me to say:
Thank you.
Truly, from the bottom of my heart, thank you.

Back in Folca, Id and the crew head to the church
where Rolan lived, hoping to find a way to save him.
After a talk with an islander there, Id resolves to take
on Rolan's job as a handyman. The islander is uncertain
about Id, knowing nothing about him, but is persuaded
after hearing that the others will help, and decides to
entrust him with a job.

Id gets his first-ever request: to defeat some goblins
and retrieve the supplies they stole.

A young boy approaches Id asking for tutelage in the 
art of swordsmanship. Seeing this, the crew are 
overjoyed that Id has finally been accepted by the 
other islanders.

Sierokarte tells the crew of a massive mechanical being 
that is terrorizing the skies in the region. Being familiar 
with the matter, the crew take it upon themselves to 
find a solution to the problem.
